author: danielrachi
content:
Hi everyone,

I'm making a flow chart based on the spec of `engine_newPayloadV2`. I have most of it done, but there's something I don't understand:

One of the conditions for returning `{status: ACCEPTED, ...}` is: "Ancestors of a payload are known and comprise a well-formed chain." However, the spec doesn't seem to specify the course of action when this condition isn't met, but all other conditions are. This is the `??` red block in the bottom right corner of the diagram.

What should I put in that block?

(Also, any other feedback is greatly appreciated `:)`)

author: sproul
content: actually I think it's gotta be an error or INVALID, because we 1) have all the data required for verification, and 2) one part of the verification (valid parent chain) failed

author: joohhnnn8
content: hi <@321481409552449536> I found this piece of code in geth, but it seems a bit different from your illustrated example. When `Ancestors of a payload are known and comprise a well-formed chain`is `false`, the new block is temporarily stored (ACCEPTED) until it can be processed.

author: joohhnnn8
content: I'm not sure if this part of the code corresponds to your flow chart, but if it does, then you can move the `{status: ACCEPTED, ...}` block to the red section, and change the original `{status: ACCEPTED, ...}` block to `inserting the new block into the blockchain, but without setting a new head.`
